column1: As the holiday season begins I hope that the spirit of service that has defined Virginians’ response to the pandemic will only grow. While neighbors continue to lift each other up the U.S. House and Senate MUST pass a new negotiated COVID-19 relief package.

Today is National Rural Health Day. I'm working to expand access to affordable healthcare for rural #VA07 residents by  * Fighting for strong telehealth funding as part of COVID-19 relief  * Saving the #340B program which gives deep prescription drug discounts to rural hospitals

Today the House passed the Securing America from Epidemics Act. I cosponsored this bipartisan bill to strengthen U.S. participation in an alliance of countries & private partners developing vaccines. We must work with our allies to combat COVID-19 and prepare for the future.
I’m back on Capitol Hill and focused on getting a new negotiated COVID-19 relief package to the floor of the House. #VA07 https://t.co/pQIk6XWbHn

The election is over and the partisan talking points have been exhausted. Progress on another negotiated COVID-19 relief package is long overdue.  Compromise is within reach and I stand ready to work with anyone who is invested in reaching a deal before the end of the year. https://t.co/As9VvuVI9f

Meeting the urgent needs in #VA07 remains my top priority.  Leadership in both parties told Central Virginia small business owners teachers working families & healthcare providers to wait until after the election.    It's past time to get back to the table on COVID-19 relief. https://t.co/83gnUXBagh

I worked to make sure ag producers were eligible for COVID-19 aid through EIDL and I'm fighting to make sure they're included in a new relief bill. Without our farmers Americans go hungry. We need to deliver additional support for family farms on the edge of bankruptcy. #VA07

* Navigating COVID-19 programs like PPP and EIDL * Status updates on IRS returns and refunds * Problems with Social Security  * Problems with Veterans Affairs * Getting military service records  * Problems with Medicare  * Problems with Medicaid  * Getting a passport

With open enrollment season underway and many ongoing needs related to the COVID-19 pandemic I wanted to remind you of some of the ways my office serves #VA07 residents.   We are here to assist with any issues related to a federal program benefit or agency including ⬇️
#VA07 CVS is expanding the number of COVID-19 testing sites in our area. Full list of pharmacies where you and your family can get tested ⬇️ https://t.co/1o2kckQrWf

I introduced the SAVE for Seniors Act earlier this month to make a future COVID-19 vaccine free to all Medicare beneficiaries. I'm glad to see the administration working toward the same goal. No American senior should pay out-of-pocket for a vaccine. #VA07 https://t.co/wXMcOE3hgk

As our neighbors communities and small businesses struggle in need of an additional relief bill the Senate held an all-night session.   Not to debate COVID-19 relief not to create a deal but instead to rush through a Supreme Court nominee. (2/4)

COVID-19 has shown how one event can have a domino effect on everything from food to telecom. I introduced the bipartisan ADVANCE Act to strengthen our ability to predict threats & prevent the fallout so we're never caught unprepared in a future crisis. https://t.co/xk2OVSnymX

In #VA07 restaurants have closed & more are on the brink due to COVID-19. Congress must act to help them survive. I'm supporting two bills to provide additional grants and loans – flexible funds that could cover costs like rent utilities & winterizing. https://t.co/OLPef47vsW

Yesterday I was pleased to have @repblumenauer join our roundtable with #VA07 restaurant owners & managers. We took questions and updated folks on our work to get targeted grants & forgivable loans for restaurants included in future COVID-19 relief. More on the RESTAURANTS Act: https://t.co/Lgl1304ejt

Seniors are the most vulnerable to COVID-19 and ensuring that all older Americans have affordable access to a vaccine is a top priority. Thank you @RepDustyJohnson for working with me on this vital bipartisan bill. #VA07  https://t.co/hCDdpdUbXj

I'm working across the aisle to make sure no senior has to pay out-of-pocket for a COVID-19 vaccine. Cost shouldn’t prevent any American – especially the most vulnerable – from protecting themselves & receiving a vaccine when it's available. #VA07 https://t.co/tLDSmvnyla

Removing the barrier of cost is vital for making sure that as many seniors as possible receive a COVID-19 vaccine. Today I introduced a bill that would make sure NO seniors have to pay out-of-pocket for a vaccine. #VA07 https://t.co/kQmeRlR2uC

Today I'm introducing the SAVE for Seniors Act with @RepDustyJohnson. Our bipartisan bill would correct an error in the CARES Act to make sure that seniors with traditional Medicare coverage don't have to pay out-of-pocket for a COVID-19 vaccine. #VA07  https://t.co/fEaKSWnwkH

Lack of internet has a very real impact on #VA07 families and their access to education telehealth and economic opportunity. COVID-19 has only made the issue more urgent.  Just yesterday I sent a new broadband survey to my constituents – I've already received 800+ responses. https://t.co/uwrkrwpuj3

Stories like this are repeated all over #VA07 and the country. More than ever students need reliable internet access. I've fought to cut burdensome penalties for rural internet providers and strengthen broadband funding in COVID-19 relief legislation. https://t.co/YIkEn1egLt

The global COVID-19 pandemic has underscored that infectious disease is a national security issue. In a recent hearing @HouseForeign discussed how U.S. security agencies can become more resilient in case of future pandemics or other biological threats. https://t.co/tdA9cwc283

Wetlands aren't just beautiful – they also provide vital economic benefits like protecting property from floods generating recreation revenue and more. I appreciated the chance to hear about how groups like @DucksUnlimited are continuing their important work during COVID-19. https://t.co/Sv5QbgvzlO

Our nation’s response to COVID-19 is not a game and as each day passes without progress on a bipartisan relief package Americans are facing the increasing effects of hunger bankruptcy or the loss of a job. (1/5)

HHS is making an additional $20 billion available from the CARES Act for healthcare providers fighting COVID-19.   Dentists assisted living facilities mental health & addiction services providers and others can apply now.  Click here to learn more:  https://t.co/6aMCdrIhBX.
Transparency is important.  Yesterday amid reports of lawmakers contracting COVID-19 I was tested for the virus and my test came back negative.

Today I spoke with @VAHeadstart to get an update on COVID-19 hurdles & to hear more about the support they need to continue serving low-income families. When I visited Culpeper Head Start last year I saw how hard these teachers work to build a strong foundation for #VA07 kids. https://t.co/diKQpA989A

Our country's economic recovery in the wake of COVID-19 may be long and uneven. Our legislation would work to set more students up for success by connecting them to apprenticeship opportunities that prepare them for well paying highly-skilled jobs. #VA07 https://t.co/9OdZOLx5mg

Today I chaired a @HouseAgDems subcommittee hearing on COVID-19's impact on @USDA_NRCS programs. Like so many Americans farmers have also felt the awful financial effects of this pandemic and voluntary conservation programs can aid economic recovery. https://t.co/OX2UaClnJV

I'm hearing from #VA07 neighbors in both parties who are concerned about the fate of our current healthcare system. Without the #ACA insurers could deny people with a preexisting condition – and COVID-19 is checking that box for more Americans every day. https://t.co/fzFFD9llcg

Continuous manufacturing also decreases cost improves quality control and reduces the interruptions that cause shortages. COVID-19 has exposed critical vulnerabilities in our medical supply chain but this legislation will help us lessen our dependency on foreign drug makers. https://t.co/CwmXBeoDZ6

In crises past we've seen that our strongest national bonds are not based on fear but on a shared commitment to American ideals. As our #VA07 community continues to battle COVID-19 I condemn baseless attacks against Asian Americans. This rhetoric only divides and distracts us. https://t.co/On2I1cdIxL

I'm glad a bipartisan agreement has been reached to keep critical programs funded & avoid a government shutdown.  Additionally I'm encouraged by this package's support for U.S. farmers. Now we must focus on moving bipartisan COVID-19 relief forward.  https://t.co/qiIfVXMHZA

For years rural Virginians have been facing healthcare challenges like hospital closures long wait times and a shrinking number of doctors and specialists. During COVID-19 the barriers to accessing affordable healthcare have become even higher. (1/3)

House and Senate leadership need to come to the middle on a continuing resolution to fund the government AND a new comprehensive COVID-19 relief package. While they delay American agribusinesses and family farms are hurting. #VA07 https://t.co/jRjMlDCnpx

Each of the 200000 Americans we have lost to the COVID-19 pandemic was loved. They were parents spouses children and friends. This is a national-scale tragedy yet intensely personal in each home that’s missing someone. My heart breaks for their loss. https://t.co/smScHyyfaJ

Reminder: many resources & details on COVID-19 relief efforts in our #VA07 communities are listed on my website. Visit https://t.co/FsE0H9xopO for info on food banks school meal assistance unemployment insurance and more. If you have questions please call us at (804) 401-4110. https://t.co/lbmDUn8zjW

The new bipartisan COVID-19 relief plan I introduced yesterday with @ProbSolveCaucus isn't about serving the interests of one person or party — it's about serving the American people. THAT is our duty. #VA07 needs help and I urge leadership in both parties to consider our plan. https://t.co/ZVum5J5u0K

Today I helped introduce a bipartisan package to help break the gridlock on COVID-19 relief.   Standing on the sidelines in this moment of national uncertainty is out of the question and leadership in both parties must get back to the negotiating table. https://t.co/b7Mxv2kyP3

Some key aspects of our plan to break the stalemate in Washington & deliver the next phase of real COVID-19 relief:    - Funding for increased COVID-19 testing   - Second stimulus check for American families & individuals with fixes to make sure people aren't left out this time

Today I joined my @ProbSolveCaucus colleagues to introduce a new completely bipartisan COVID-19 relief package to meet the urgent needs of our nation. Compromise is possible and it's time for leadership from both parties to follow our lead and break this partisan gridlock. https://t.co/wU0VcHJ6Tw

I worked for weeks with 24 Democrats and 25 Republicans to put together a new COVID-19 relief plan. We have proven that PROGRESS IS POSSIBLE. It's high time that House & Senate leaders took our cue and got back to the negotiating table. They can start by considering our package. https://t.co/v8qSb7go6l

TV pundits may move on but make no mistake – families in #VA07 and across the country are still struggling due to the ongoing pandemic and economic crisis. @ChesterfieldFo1 is feeding 30000 people per month up from 8000-12000 before COVID-19. https://t.co/q4zLBZUn2z
#VA07 passing along an update from the IRS for people who don't typically file a federal tax return and haven't yet received a COVID-19 economic impact check from the IRS: https://t.co/T7mDj8yGZR

Today's @HouseForeign hearing confirmed what we feared — COVID-19 has provided authoritarian actors with a smokescreen to undermine democratic institutions and escalate their aggression against aspiring democratic societies like the people of #Belarus. https://t.co/z8knUatZKJ
The workers at this facility have adapted to the disruption of COVID-19 and the added challenges of operational changes made by Postmaster General DeJoy. https://t.co/NKxYbIG3qe

As #VA07's economy recovers after COVID-19 we can help by maintaining federal excise tax levels for local craft breweries & distilleries. Unless Congress acts the industry could face a major tax hike in 2021 — I've cosponsored legislation to avoid this. https://t.co/liEQbFQfVB

#VA07 have you answered the prescription drug survey yet? After receiving thousands of responses earlier this year we're trying to update our information in light of COVID-19. Your input matters to me! Take 3 minutes or less to add your voice. https://t.co/KIBkX6ooVU

This afternoon I met with Virginia union leaders to discuss the impact COVID-19 continues to have on the Commonwealth's workers and what measures they would like to see in the next relief package to support working families. #VA07 https://t.co/SPVTdhBqOU

Today I met with #VA07 career & technical professionals to discuss workforce development in the era of COVID-19. In uncertain times & worsening economic conditions #CTE is more vital than ever. We need to give people the training they need to launch (or relaunch) their careers. https://t.co/UVGwq8U3az

In Virginia Black and Latino communities have been hospitalized or killed by COVID-19 at a higher rate than white communities. Many doctors nurses & healthcare providers in Central Virginia are working to reject this status quo and close the gap. #VA07 https://t.co/CK9YQwaGFz

Today I met with local robotics team @TALON540 from Godwin High School. To remain competitive we need to invest in a strong diverse STEM workforce. I appreciated the chance to discuss leadership workforce development & COVID-19's impact with these amazing students. #VA07 https://t.co/2ufKl97erq

Several constituents who joined our #VA07 town hall mentioned that their insurance requires them to use a specific pharmacy. That limitation has become burdensome for many as some pharmacies adapt better than others to the challenges of COVID-19 and unreliable mail delivery.

I'm thankful for the service of leaders like @VaSecofHealth and the Henrico Health Department. I encourage everyone to contact their local health department for information about free COVID-19 testing. Phone numbers for each #VA07 department are listed at https://t.co/FsE0H9xopO. https://t.co/5GeWwEGWQY

In today's @RTDNEWS — I got a COVID-19 test.   Getting a test is safe quick & easy — and it helps keep you and your neighbors safe.   On Thursday September 3 you can join a @HenricoNews testing event at Tuckahoe Middle School from 9am to 11am.  (📸 from Joe Mahoney RTD) https://t.co/Yg0CD40dCT

Important reminder if you're in the area! The @HenricoNews Health Department is doing free COVID-19 testing this morning at Tuckahoe Middle School. It's an easy and efficient process! #VA07  9000 Three Chopt Rd Richmond VA 23229 9:00-11:00 AM Rain or Shine

As if a maternal health crisis weren't enough we're also seeing Black and Latino communities suffer disproportionate rates of infection hospitalization and death due to COVID-19. These disparities are horrific and utterly unacceptable. #VA07

Today I held a roundtable with healthcare providers & advocates from across Central Virginia to discuss the twin crises impacting minority communities – horrific rates of maternal & infant mortality & the highly disproportionate rates of infection & death from COVID-19. #VA07 https://t.co/AYhm78Znft

Thank you to the Virginia Medical Reserve Corps volunteers who are moving mountains with the force of their adaptability and dedication. These medical students retired health workers and concerned neighbors from all backgrounds are pivotal in the fight against COVID-19. #VA07 https://t.co/mIUvGHbNMa

Health departments across the Richmond area have greatly increased their COVID-19 testing capacity — the challenge now is increasing awareness and encouraging people to get tested. #VA07 https://t.co/ed2N85tvBV

This afternoon I stopped by the Hotchkiss COVID-19 testing event to see the Henrico Health Department's community testing strategy in action and to thank the many professionals and volunteers who are working incredibly hard to keep our communities safe. #VA07 https://t.co/DM6JAkUY9x

As health departments across #VA07 continue to battle this pandemic I encourage Central Virginians to use COVIDWISE. This free app was developed by the Commonwealth to aid in contact tracing and it doesn't collect any of your private data. Learn more at https://t.co/poUMIGpidk.
Finally we discussed how we can best support minority and low-income communities in Central Virginia who have been disproportionately hit by the COVID-19 pandemic. #VA07 https://t.co/t276YSivrv

Today I visited the @HenricoNews Health Department to meet with Medical Director Dr. Danny Avula and a dedicated team of employees. I heard more about the challenges they're facing at this point in the COVID-19 public health crisis. #VA07 https://t.co/F639dxRfZm

Yesterday I met with local mental health professionals from across #VA07. We discussed the challenges they face while providing care in our public schools substance abuse treatment & recovery programs and other therapeutic settings both before and during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/wIutpdEc6e

This is a welcome first step but #VA07 needs more than stop-gap funds and temporary fixes. The more uncertain the future is for working families the more prolonged this economic crisis is. We need to make progress on the next COVID-19 package. https://t.co/PxRlBYJonA

Attention #VA07! My office has updated & improved our COVID-19 webpage. Visit https://t.co/FsE0H9xopO for a streamlined list of resources related to small business grants & loans unemployment benefits housing & eviction food assistance Virginia's phased reopening and more.

While the House reconvenes to take emergency action on the #USPS we need to also move forward on next steps to address COVID-19. The news cycle may move on but the need for solutions like telehealth in #VA07 is still VERY urgent. I'll continue pushing for additional funding. https://t.co/FXWxWk0h3j

.@Broadfork_Farm's innovative use of crop rotation testing disease-resistant plants and planting techniques that maximize soil nutrient content have made the business more resilient in the face of challenges like the COVID-19 pandemic and economic downturn. #VA07 https://t.co/iuEBHlrSdx

Many of the essential deliveries that have enabled families to stay home & stay safe during COVID-19 are actually carried the final few miles by @USPS because private companies don't see an incentive to deliver to the most remote parts of rural counties like Amelia and Nottoway.

We discussed how their business has responded to the challenges of COVID-19 and what their experience has been as recipients of a PPP loan. Direct feedback from owners Kendall and Margo Ickes will help me better fight for our local priorities in the next relief package. #VA07 https://t.co/gd0FN7ETCz

Virginia has developed a contact tracing app called COVIDWISE. It's private free and doesn't collect any personal data. Download in the App Store or Google Play! The more we work together to stop this second spike of cases the sooner we can safely return to our routines. #VA07 https://t.co/yTXrh9jelE

We cannot allow this burden to fall on local business owners as they struggle to recover from the COVID-19 crisis. I will continue working across the aisle to ensure that the federal excise tax cuts that many Central Virginia distilleries depend on are made permanent. #VA07 https://t.co/0qCxFe63tm

Today I visited Three Crosses Distilling in Powhatan to learn about how this veteran-owned small business is innovating in the face of the COVID-19 crisis and to listen to their concerns about relief efforts. I also met with leaders from @vaspirits & @DistilledSpirit. #VA07 https://t.co/A7MYWevmzG

Destroying these options when #VA07 needs them the most is reckless. It's a slap in the face to our fundamental values of looking out for our neighbors & protecting the vulnerable. I will keep fighting to expand access to affordable healthcare coverage during COVID-19 & beyond.

COVID-19 has reminded us how much we depend on a strong healthcare workforce. I'm pleased to announce this $1185880 federal grant which will help @VHWDA recruit & train health workers for careers in Virginia serving our region for years to come. #VA07  https://t.co/4bUbFavmqa

Without school or activities many kids have lost the opportunity to report when they're being abused or exploited. While we continue fighting COVID-19 we MUST account for kids who have fewer & fewer ways to get help. My bill would be a first step. #VA07 https://t.co/a6bWM0Z40t
Important update for anyone in #VA07 who is facing the loss of housing due to COVID-19. Pass it on and know your rights!  https://t.co/vJR5zit9Ob

Voting by mail is a safe option for Americans who are concerned about voting in person during a COVID-19 surge. We have a duty to ensure Americans have confidence in our democratic process — we must reverse these changes at @USPS strengthen security & prepare for higher volume. https://t.co/OchsTvqNGK

Today I joined @RepDustyJohnson to fight for funding for critical telehealth programs in the next COVID-19 relief package. From coast to coast rural U.S. communities are depending on telehealth to stay safe & get necessary care during this crisis. #VA07  https://t.co/Y2biTntutA

4 hours until this evening's telephone town hall! This will be our 8th virtual town hall since the COVID-19 pandemic began impacting Virginia in March and our 22nd since I took office. #VA07 https://t.co/390mP5dfMj

The need for reliable broadband internet access in #VA07 has become even more urgent during the COVID-19 crisis for 👩‍⚕️Seniors in need of telemedecine 📚 Kids attending school virtually 💵 Business owners and workers trying to find & apply for direct assistance  #RuralBroadbandDay https://t.co/HnDg89YTcs

Negotiations between House and Senate leadership on a new COVID-19 relief package have stalled. This is unacceptable. The CARES Act in March proved that we can work quickly with bipartisan & bicameral support to address a crisis and we need that same urgency now. (2/4)

Negotiations on a new COVID-19 package have stalled. House & Senate leadership must realize that the livelihoods of REAL FAMILIES in #VA07 and across the country are on the line. Congress can't sit idly by as families teeter on the brink of financial ruin. https://t.co/ZxH8SR3yBY

In #VA07 we’ve seen firsthand how telemedicine is critical to keeping seniors families and veterans safe during COVID-19. Without this lifeline thousands of Central Virginians could be cut off from their routine appointments and lifesaving care.  https://t.co/PGxqn2eo9y

Both bills passed with bipartisan support —  Child Care is Essential Act: awards grants to childcare providers to help cover increased costs due to COVID-19.  Child Care for Economic Recovery Act: provides tuition assistance and copay relief to working parents. (2/3)

The President’s suggestion to postpone the upcoming election is a dangerous distraction from the actual challenges Americans face. It undermines confidence in the integrity of voting by mail — a safe and secure option for those worried about their health amid COVID-19. (1/3) https://t.co/56msgLOQQp

Today I discussed priorities for the next COVID-19 relief package with local county officials. One of my goals is securing aid for localities to ensure that our communities have the PPE and staff to keep providing essential services we count on like EMS and power. #VA07 https://t.co/tEsWNUCe6M

Telehealth has clearly demonstrated its importance and its popularity during the pandemic.  The COVID-19 Telehealth Program Extension Act recognizes the role this technology should continue to play especially as we see a resurgence of the virus in communities across the country.

During COVID-19 telemedicine has been a vital lifeline for thousands in #VA07.   Unfortunately the @FCC’s COVID-19 Telehealth Program ran out of funding this month.  I introduced a bill today to fund this program & make sure patients stay connected.  https://t.co/nFF3Xfvb4q

During the COVID-19 pandemic we’ve seen the importance of having safe & accessible public lands in which to reflect and grow.   The Great American Outdoors Act both protects our nation’s priceless natural resources and supports the growing outdoor recreation economy. https://t.co/yFM1LvOo87

Telehealth is playing an increasingly important role in healthcare delivery during the COVID-19 pandemic.  Today @RepDustyJohnson and I led 39 Democrats and Republicans in calling on the @FCC to provide greater support to healthcare providers offering these critical services. https://t.co/m52smfipn8

Today I’m sitting in on a (socially distanced) @HouseAgDems Subcommittee hearing on COVID-19 food aid programs.   Last month after hearing concerns from our region’s food banks about increased demand I urged @USDA to deliver proportional food aid to Virginia families in need. https://t.co/iP160Yf7Wm

As lawmakers debate the next round of COVID-19 relief we need to push for strengthened transparency.  I recently joined my @HouseBlueDogs colleagues in calling on Congress to pass new measures to protect taxpayer dollars in future funding packages.  https://t.co/kpbziltTc2

In a recent Gallup poll nearly 9 in 10 adults said they are concerned about rising drug costs amid COVID-19.  I’m relaunching my 2020 Prescription Drug Survey to give #VA07 families the opportunity to voice their concerns.   Share your story here ➡️ https://t.co/KIBkX6ooVU https://t.co/hjovykwhU3

Local businesses shouldn’t have to navigate miles of red tape & scramble for emergency assistance that they’re already entitled to. Greater flexibility for PPP borrowers will help #VA07 small businesses endure the sustained hardship presented by COVID-19. https://t.co/gH0clSEapC

COVID-19 has raised healthcare costs in many ways including prescription drug prices for some Virginians. Listening to those I serve is the most important part of my job and I want to hear from #VA07. Take our survey ➡️ https://t.co/KIBkX6ooVU https://t.co/ZSxNIMiWPm

Thousands of Central Virginians responded to our first #VA07 prescription drug survey and their input helped guide our work this year. In light of COVID-19 we want to update our info. Will you voice your opinion in our new prescription drug survey? ➡️ https://t.co/KIBkX6ooVU

Our 7th virtual town hall since the COVID-19 crisis began is tomorrow night. We'll be joined by @VDHgov Commissioner Oliver & I hope many of you will take this opportunity to ask us questions directly. Details on how to ask a question or just listen in:  https://t.co/G8ab04eAXJ

#VA07 we have another telephone town hall coming up this week. Join us Wednesday evening by dialing (855) 920-0555 or listen live online. @VDHgov Commissioner Oliver will be on the line to help answer questions on the ongoing healthcare challenges of the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/bxrAIjO5Or

Thank you Leslie for sharing your insights into caregiver work navigating Medicaid and handling COVID-19 as the parent of a child with special needs. I appreciated the opportunity to learn more about disability issues firsthand from a #VA07 family! https://t.co/fBHHzyI0j2

TOWN HALL THIS WEEK: We'll be on the line with @VDHgov Commissioner Oliver to discuss the challenges facing #VA07 patients providers & healthcare systems as COVID-19 continues. To ask a question dial (855) 920-0555. To listen visit https://t.co/EYVuiVQVKO or my Facebook page. https://t.co/5v6VTK8LIZ

Free & low-cost clinics are vital to thousands of uninsured families in Virginia. As COVID-19 persists we cannot forget the ongoing needs of Americans at EVERY income level. I raised this in a bipartisan letter to @HHSGov Sec. Azar in June – no response. https://t.co/Y1gihJky4X

I thank my colleagues @RepElaineLuria @RobWittman & @RepRiggleman for their work on this bill. COVID-19 has made it even clearer that computer access is vital for keeping up in the digital economy. Our bill would close the #DigitalDivide for more veterans seniors & students.

Today I enjoyed joining @JCFRichmond's forum with @RepMcEachin. Central Virginia's Jewish community has a long history with justice and equity work and I appreciated the chance to discuss recent local calls for police reform the ongoing COVID-19 response and more. #VA07 https://t.co/Ra5J5eYIFK

Protecting the lives of our grandparents and neighbors should be just as important now as it was four months ago. As COVID-19 cases spike nationwide for the second time we must fully use the Defense Production Act to equip long term care facilities. (2/2) #VA07

This afternoon I held a Conservation & Forestry subcommittee call on the ongoing wildfire season. During COVID-19 factors like living in close quarters pose added risk to our wildland firefighters. To view a map of current and forecasted fires visit https://t.co/FXDAM0p2dN https://t.co/SWz7ZlnFn0
#VA07 update on COVID-19 testing in the area.  https://t.co/oGOiZ5hWaj

During the COVID-19 crisis these clinics have experienced a decline in charitable giving surges in new patients and heightened demand for their healthcare services — which now range from COVID-19 testing to expanded telehealth appointments.   https://t.co/JsOPaiUiHt

This week I'm proud to recognize a second round of constituents in our #VA07 Heroes program. These Central Virginians have gone above and beyond to serve their communities working tirelessly to care for others in the face of the COVID-19 pandemic and economic hardship. THREAD:

Mr. Kochar we are working on your case and we will find every way possible to bring you back home. This is the hustle that our team brings to every constituent case. If you need help COVID-19 related or otherwise please call (804) 401-4110. #VA07 https://t.co/oZy8DcOIsP

3. Equitable Data Collection and Disclosure on COVID-19 Act. I cosponsored this bill because it's clear that minority communities are suffering disproportionately high fatality rates during this pandemic. We need consistent demographic data related to COVID-19. (8/10)

I’m grateful to have a diverse range voices who can speak to the intersection of COVID-19 and racial inequities in Virginia. More than 4100 people tuned or dialed in for yesterday's virtual town hall and I thank our panelists for lending their expertise. https://t.co/NFlxWEVRy3

Millions of families waiting on a refund sensitive documents piled up in trailers – from the start the IRS response to COVID-19 has been totally inadequate. I'll keep pushing until #VA07 taxpayers receive the refund dollars that are rightfully theirs. https://t.co/OP9rb38By7

In the Henrico Health District alone Black Americans account for 43% of COVID-19 deaths but only 30% of the population. Minority communities have been hit disproportionately hard and we need a strategy for the future. Join tomorrow's virtual town hall: https://t.co/i8eBMLG5Zk

Thank you @FamilyEconomyVA for a productive virtual meeting today. The issue of paid family leave intersects with nearly every other challenge our country currently faces - the continuing impacts of COVID-19 economic downturn racial disparities and more. #VA07 https://t.co/djSObEduSw

Tomorrow's virtual town hall with @RepUnderwood will focus on COVID-19's disproportionate impact on minority communities. #VA07  Ask a question ➡️ (855) 920-0555   Watch the livestream ➡️ my Facebook page  Ask a question AND watch the livestream ➡️ https://t.co/EYVuiVQVKO https://t.co/GDIobFiRP0

Last month I announced the first round of #VA07 Heroes to recognize some of the volunteers businesses nonprofits and organizations that have stepped up to help our neighbors during the COVID-19 pandemic.   Learn more about their stories on @Medium:   https://t.co/s9n5GLs0WK

100000 Americans have lost their lives to COVID-19. They are not just names on a list; they are loved ones and neighbors who are forever lost to this world. Today we honor their memories and mourn the loss facing many American families. #DayOfMourning https://t.co/WVvZSQnrgz

Our telephone town hall is starting soon! Join us by dialing (855) 920-0555 from 7:40-8:40 or listen in live at https://t.co/EYVuiVQVKO. For our 5th tele-town hall since the COVID-19 pandemic began we'll be focusing on the top concerns specific to seniors and caregivers. #VA07

Our town hall for #VA07 seniors and caregivers is coming up tonight. Join us from home by dialing (855) 920-0555 between 7:40-8:40 pm. We'll be covering the latest updates on COVID-19 with leaders from @AARPVa and @vadars on the line to answer questions. https://t.co/dzHOlRaEQL

Reminder: we have a telephone town hall this evening. Our focus tonight will be on COVID-19 questions and updates specific for Virginia seniors and caregivers. To ask a question dial (855) 920-0555 from 7:40-8:40 pm. You can also listen live at https://t.co/EYVuiVQVKO. #VA07
